required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Two-year Trial to Examine the Changes in Exercise Endurance and COPD Treated With Tiotropium Once Daily (EXACTT)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the effects on exercise duration of 96 weeks treatment with 18 mcg tiotropium (Spiriva HandiHaler) daily as compared to placebo, in patients with COPD.

primary_outcome.measure: 90% Constant Work Rate (CWR) Treadmill Endurance Time at 96 Weeks - Double-Blind Phase
primary_outcome.description: Efficacy was assessed by measuring the exercise duration during a treadmill exercise test.

secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy was assessed by measuring the exercise duration during a treadmill exercise test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Physician Global Evaluation at 8 Weeks - Double-Blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: The evaluation represented the global opinion of the overall clinical condition on a scale of: 1-2 (Poor), 3-4 (Fair), 5-6 (Good), 7-8 (Excellent)

secondary_outcome.measure: Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire Total Score at 96 Weeks - Double-Blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Score summarises the impact of disease on overall health status with zero indicating best health status and 100 indicating worst possible health status.

secondary_outcome.description: Score summarises the impact of disease on overall health status with zero indicating best health status and 100 indicating worst possible health status.

secondary_outcome.description: Score summarises the impact of disease on overall health status with zero indicating best health status and 100 indicating worst possible health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients With COPD Exacerbation (Survival Analysis) - Double-Blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: COPD exacerbation is a complex of symptoms related to COPD with a duration of three days or more requiring a change of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: 90% Constant Work Rate (CWR) Treadmill Endurance Time at 100 Weeks - Open-Label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy was assessed by measuring the exercise duration during a treadmill exercise test.

secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the maximal amount of air you can forcefully exhale in one second.

secondary_outcome.description: FVC is the volume of air that can be forcibly blown out after full inspiration.

secondary_outcome.description: Score summarises the impact of disease on overall health status with zero indicating best health status and 100 indicating worst possible health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Relevant Abnormalities for Vital Signs and Physical Examination, Including Vital Status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first drug administration until 30 days after last drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Relevant Abnormalities for Vital Signs and Physical examination, including vital status. Any new or clinically relevant worsening of baseline conditions was reported as Adverse Events.

arm_group.description: Oral inhalation once daily of 18mcg tiotropium via handihaler
Oral inhalation once daily of placebo matching tiotropium via handihaler

intervention.description: Oral inhalation once daily of 18mcg tiotropium via handihaler
Oral inhalation of once-daily placebo matching tiotropium via handihaler

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
1. All patients must sign an informed consent
2. Diagnosis of COPD with specific spirometric criteria (determined at study visits)
3. Age >= 40 years
4. Medical Research Council Dyspnoea score >= 2
5. Current or ex-smoker with a >= 10 pack-year smoking history
6. Ability to exercise on treadmill
Exclusion criteria
1. Significant diseases other than COPD such as history of life-threatening pulmonary obstruction, thoracotomy with pulmonary resection, interstitial lung disease, CF, pulmonary thromboembolic disease, clinically evident bronchiectasis, active tuberculosis, or known moderate to severe renal impairment
2. Clinical history of asthma
3. Use of supplemental oxygen therapy
4. Respiratory tract infection or COPD exacerbation in the 6 weeks prior to Visit 1 or during the washout period prior to Visit 3 (may randomize 6 weeks after recovery)
5. Recent history (<= 12 months) of myocardial infarction
6. Unstable or life-threatening cardiac arrhythmia
7. Malignancy treated with radiation therapy or chemotherapy in the last 5 years
8. Pregnant or nursing women
9. Known hypersensitivity to anticholinergic drugs or any component of the study medications
10. Participation in pulmonary or cardiac rehab program within 13 weeks of Visit 1
11. Estimated life expectancy < 2 years
12. Symptomatic prostatic hyperplasia or bladder neck obstruction
13. Known narrow-angle glaucoma
14. Any condition that is contraindicated for exercise
15. Orthopaedic, muscular, neurological or cardiac disease that would interfere with regular participation in aerobic exercise or with exercise testing
16. Body mass index < 18 kg/m2 or >35 kg/m2 list truncated for space

group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo

outcome.title: 90% Constant Work Rate (CWR) Treadmill Endurance Time at 96 Weeks - Double-Blind Phase
outcome.description: Efficacy was assessed by measuring the exercise duration during a treadmill exercise test.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) includes all treated participants with a baseline and any post-dosing exercise duration data

group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo

group.title: Tiotropium

measure.title: 90% Constant Work Rate (CWR) Treadmill Endurance Time at 96 Weeks - Double-Blind Phase

analysis.p_value_desc: Based on a MMRM analysis with terms for treatment, centre and baseline.

outcome.title: 90% Constant Work Rate (CWR) Treadmill Endurance Time at 100 Weeks - Open-Label Phase
outcome.description: Efficacy was assessed by measuring the exercise duration during a treadmill exercise test.

group.title: Placebo / Open Tiotropium
group.description: Patients receive open label tiotropium following placebo

group.title: Tiotropium / Open Tiotropium
group.description: Patients receive open label tiotropium following tiotropium

measure.title: 90% Constant Work Rate (CWR) Treadmill Endurance Time at 100 Weeks - Open-Label Phase
measure.description: Efficacy was assessed by measuring the exercise duration during a treadmill exercise test.

analysis.p_value_desc: Based on a ANCOVA analysis with terms for treatment, centre and baseline.

group.title: Tiotropium / Open Tiotropium
group.description: Patients receive open label tiotropium following tiotropium

measure.title: Post-treatment Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) at 100 Weeks - Open-Label Phase
measure.description: FVC is the volume of air that can be forcibly blown out after full inspiration.

analysis.p_value_desc: Based on a ANCOVA analysis with terms for treatment, centre and baseline.

outcome.title: Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire Total Score at 100 Weeks - Open-Label Phase
outcome.description: Score summarises the impact of disease on overall health status with zero indicating best health status and 100 indicating worst possible health status.

outcome.title: Clinical Relevant Abnormalities for Vital Signs and Physical Examination, Including Vital Status
outcome.description: Clinical Relevant Abnormalities for Vital Signs and Physical examination, including vital status. Any new or clinically relevant worsening of baseline conditions was reported as Adverse Events.
outcome.time_frame: From first drug administration until 30 days after last drug administration

group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
